conclusion: Determine which light will first undergo total internal reflection by analyzing angles and refractive indices.
Light a and light b are perpendicular to the hypotenuse of an equilateral triangular prism.
The angle of incidence into the prism is 60° for both lights.
Snell’s Law relates the angles and refractive indices of two media.
For light entering from air to glass, the refractive index of air is approximately 1.
Total internal reflection occurs when the angle of incidence exceeds the critical angle.
The critical angle is given by sin(θc) = 1/n, where n is the refractive index of the glass.
The light with the higher refractive index will have a smaller critical angle.
If light b undergoes total internal reflection first, its refractive index is higher than that of light a.
The statement 'light b will first undergo total internal reflection' is correct.
